name: Crunch
description:
Crunch is an unofficial conversion of the arcade game Stompin' that was released by Bally and Sente in 1986.

The player must use the keyboard to stomp out a variety of animals (including ants, mice, bees and birds) which emerge from mouse holes around the edges of the screen and try to steal the food in the centre of the screen. The game differ from the arcade in many ways, animals are different and also in gameplay there are different "levels" of difficulty and changing graphics, starting indoor (kitchen) to outdoor (garden).

The game was released through n°38 of the Load 'n' Run compilations.
